page.title: 03 Radcot Bridge, Part 2
page.content: Radcot Bridge is notorious to traffic whether on road or on water! The road approach from the north, after Pidnell Bridge, is steep and angled, the bridges themselves are narrow and humpbacked, single line traffic only. The main bridge also causes problems to river navigation.It is probably one of the most hazardous on the river, being very narrow and at an angle, with extra difficulties from both current and wind. Radcot was the scene of conflict on at least three occasions in the past. It was the site of a battle during the Civil War and another in 1387. There are earthworks still visible, to the north of the bridges, remains of the Garrison built by Matilda in 1141 and remains of even older wharves.
